titleStmt.title: The Loyal London prentice being his constant resolution to hazard his life and fortune for his king : with his defiance to popery and faction ... : to a pleasant old tune called The royal rose.

notesStmt.note: "I'le plainly make it to appear, that I'm a true born cavaleir, and here my colours have display'd, 'gainst all the factious that invade. I wear this ribbond in ny [sic] hatt, for all the Whiggs to wonder at, let none then tax my loyalty, my king I'le serve until I dye."
Reproductions of originals in the Harvard University Library and the British Library.
